title.narrative: Stabilization and Early Reintegration Support for Returnees in South Sudan.

description.narrative: Stabilization & Early Reintegration Support for Returnees in South Sudan The proposed projects seeks to provide community-based early reintegration support in communities that have been affected by an influx of returnees resettling back in Southern Sudan through the provision of livelihood recovery and economic reintegration. Outputs: - Livelihoods supported through provision of training in return communities, targeting a total of 1500 beneficiaries by ILO, prioritizing women/female headed households and youth. - Beneficiaries receive small grants to help them start their small business (IOM). Up to 413 recipients of ILO GYB training will receive business start up kits. Up to 300 “at risk” youth from the target area will receive vocational training courses in subject areas provide the greatest likelihood of employment following course completion. - 36 local construction company representatives from target area receive contractor training to improve competitiveness. Target: - Small-grants scheme for SMEs and vocational training opportunities established in the 3 target States. - 1500 beneficiaries receive entrepreneurship /skills training.
